The PLplot Plotting Library: Programmer's Reference Manual

plsesc: Set the escape character for text strings

plsesc (esc);

Set the escape character for text strings. From C (in contrast to Fortran 77, see plsescfortran77) you pass esc as a character. Only selected characters are allowed to prevent the user from shooting himself in the foot (For example, a "\" isn't allowed since it conflicts with C's use of backslash as a character escape). Here are the allowed escape characters and their corresponding decimal ASCII values:

  • "!", ASCII 33

  • "#", ASCII 35

  • "$", ASCII 36

  • "%", ASCII 37

  • "&", ASCII 38

  • "*", ASCII 42

  • "@", ASCII 64

  • "^", ASCII 94

  • "~", ASCII 126

esc (char, input)

Escape character.

Redacted form:

  • General: plsesc(esc)

  • Perl/PDL: Not available?

This function is not used in any examples.
